    • Constructor Detail

      • PdfFile

        public PdfFile(java.lang.String path,
               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> pages,
               java.lang.Boolean toInclude,
               int fileId)
        Initializes a new PdfFile with page restrictions
        Parameters:
        path - The file path
        pages - An ArrayList with all the pages to use. Set null for full pages.
        toInclude - Whether or not this file should be merged
        fileId - File specific id

      • PdfFile

        public PdfFile(java.lang.String path,
               java.lang.Boolean toInclude,
               int fileId)
        Initializes a new PdfFile without page restrictions
        Parameters:
        path - The file path
        toInclude - Whether or not this file should be merged
        fileId - File specific id

      • PdfFile

               java.lang.String pages,
               java.lang.Boolean toInclude,
               int fileId)
        Initializes a new PdfFile with a string pages parameter
        Parameters:
        path - The file path
        pages - A String containing the pages to include
        toInclude - Whether or not this file should be merged
        fileId - File specific id

    • Method Detail

      • getPath

        public java.lang.String getPath()
        Overrides:
        getPath in class java.io.File

      • setPath

        public void setPath(java.lang.String path)

      • getPages

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getPages()
        getPages() will return the pages that the user inputted. If pages==null that means that we want *every* page. Otherwise we want just the given range. The difference with getAvailablePages() is that the latter always returns the pages that the file contains, which are not always the ones we want.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList with the range of pages.

      • getAvailablePages

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getAvailablePages()
        Opens the current file and reads the amount of pages it has
        Returns:
        An ArrayList with the same size as the pages on the current file

      • setPages

        public void setPages(java.lang.String pages)
        Transforms a range String into an ArrayList e.g "1,3-5" = {1,3,4,5}
        e.g "2-" = {2,3,4,5,6....}
        e.g "1-3,5,6-8" = {1,2,3,5,6,7,8}
        e.g "-5" = {1,2,3,4,5} e.g "10-15" = error if the file does not have a 10th page
        e.g "12-32" = error if the file does have a 12th page but not 32 pages
        Parameters:
        pages - A String representation of the selection range

        public java.lang.String getPagesString()
        Returns:
        A String version of the ArrayList containing the selected pages
